# The `X86IndirectThunks.cpp` File Reference

<DoxygenPage pluginConfig={pluginConfig}>

<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/pass">Pass</a> that injects an MI thunk that is used to lower indirect calls in a way that prevents speculation on some x86 processors and can be used to mitigate security vulnerabilities due to targeted speculative execution and side channels such as CVE-2017-5715. <a href="#details">More...</a>

## Description {#details}

<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/pass">Pass</a> that injects an MI thunk that is used to lower indirect calls in a way that prevents speculation on some x86 processors and can be used to mitigate security vulnerabilities due to targeted speculative execution and side channels such as CVE-2017-5715.

Currently supported thunks include:
<ul>
<li>Retpoline – A RET-implemented trampoline that lowers indirect calls</li>
<li>LVI Thunk – A CALL/JMP-implemented thunk that forces load serialization before making an indirect call/jump</li>
</ul>


Note that the reason that this is implemented as a <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinefunctionpass">MachineFunctionPass</a> and not a <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/modulepass">ModulePass</a> is that ModulePasses at this point in the LLVM <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/x86">X86</a> pipeline serialize all transformations, which can consume lots of memory.

TODO(chandlerc): All of this code could use better comments and documentation.

<Link id="l00086" /><CodeLine lineNumber="86"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// This code mitigates LVI by replacing each indirect call/jump with a</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00087" /><CodeLine lineNumber="87"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// direct call/jump to a thunk that looks like:</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00088" /><CodeLine lineNumber="88"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// &#96;&#96;&#96;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00089" /><CodeLine lineNumber="89"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// lfence</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00090" /><CodeLine lineNumber="90"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// jmpq &#42;%r11</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00091" /><CodeLine lineNumber="91"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// &#96;&#96;&#96;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00092" /><CodeLine lineNumber="92"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// This ensures that if the value in register %r11 was loaded from memory,</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00093" /><CodeLine lineNumber="93"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// then the value in %r11 is (architecturally) correct prior to the jump.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00131" /><CodeLine lineNumber="131"><Highlight kind="normal">    <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/silowercontrolflow-cpp/#a4868c5d81c5ccc98c47aeab6244346a0">assert</a>(MF.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinefunction/#a3d142c9e7c066059e15232c56dec9e2e">getName</a>() == </Highlight><Highlight kind="stringliteral">&quot;&#95;&#95;llvm&#95;retpoline&#95;r11&quot;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> &amp;&amp;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00132" /><CodeLine lineNumber="132"><Highlight kind="normal">           </Highlight><Highlight kind="stringliteral">&quot;Should only have an r11 thunk on 64-bit targets&quot;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">);</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00134" /><CodeLine lineNumber="134"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// &#95;&#95;llvm&#95;retpoline&#95;r11:</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00135" /><CodeLine lineNumber="135"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   callq .Lr11&#95;call&#95;target</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00136" /><CodeLine lineNumber="136"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// .Lr11&#95;capture&#95;spec:</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00137" /><CodeLine lineNumber="137"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   pause</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00139" /><CodeLine lineNumber="139"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   jmp .Lr11&#95;capture&#95;spec</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00140" /><CodeLine lineNumber="140"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// .align 16</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00141" /><CodeLine lineNumber="141"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// .Lr11&#95;call&#95;target:</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00142" /><CodeLine lineNumber="142"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   movq %r11, (%rsp)</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00143" /><CodeLine lineNumber="143"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   retq</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00144" /><CodeLine lineNumber="144"><Highlight kind="normal">    ThunkReg = X86::R11;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00145" /><CodeLine lineNumber="145"><Highlight kind="normal">  &#125; </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">else</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00146" /><CodeLine lineNumber="146"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// For 32-bit targets we need to emit a collection of thunks for various</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00147" /><CodeLine lineNumber="147"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// possible scratch registers as well as a fallback that uses EDI, which is</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00148" /><CodeLine lineNumber="148"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// normally callee saved.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00149" /><CodeLine lineNumber="149"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   &#95;&#95;llvm&#95;retpoline&#95;eax:</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00150" /><CodeLine lineNumber="150"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//         calll .Leax&#95;call&#95;target</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00151" /><CodeLine lineNumber="151"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   .Leax&#95;capture&#95;spec:</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00152" /><CodeLine lineNumber="152"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//         pause</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00153" /><CodeLine lineNumber="153"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//         jmp .Leax&#95;capture&#95;spec</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00154" /><CodeLine lineNumber="154"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   .align 16</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00155" /><CodeLine lineNumber="155"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   .Leax&#95;call&#95;target:</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00156" /><CodeLine lineNumber="156"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//         movl %eax, (%esp)  # Clobber return addr</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00157" /><CodeLine lineNumber="157"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//         retl</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00158" /><CodeLine lineNumber="158"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00162" /><CodeLine lineNumber="162"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//         retl</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00203" /><CodeLine lineNumber="203"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00204" /><CodeLine lineNumber="204"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// The MIR verifier thinks that the CALL in the entry block will fall through</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00205" /><CodeLine lineNumber="205"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// to CaptureSpec, so mark it as the successor. Technically, CaptureTarget is</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00206" /><CodeLine lineNumber="206"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// the successor, but the MIR verifier doesn&#39;t know how to cope with that.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00207" /><CodeLine lineNumber="207"><Highlight kind="normal">  Entry-&gt;addSuccessor(CaptureSpec);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00208" /><CodeLine lineNumber="208"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00209" /><CodeLine lineNumber="209"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// In the capture loop for speculation, we want to stop the processor from</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00210" /><CodeLine lineNumber="210"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// speculating as fast as possible. On Intel processors, the PAUSE instruction</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00211" /><CodeLine lineNumber="211"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// will block speculation without consuming any execution resources. On AMD</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00212" /><CodeLine lineNumber="212"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// processors, the PAUSE instruction is (essentially) a nop, so we also use an</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00213" /><CodeLine lineNumber="213"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// LFENCE instruction which they have advised will stop speculation as well</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00214" /><CodeLine lineNumber="214"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// with minimal resource utilization. We still end the capture with a jump to</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00215" /><CodeLine lineNumber="215"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// form an infinite loop to fully guarantee that no matter what implementation</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00216" /><CodeLine lineNumber="216"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// of the x86 ISA, speculating this code path never escapes.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00217" /><CodeLine lineNumber="217"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a17e04afcf0c5efeb0eb6a9a45287b5e4">BuildMI</a>(CaptureSpec, <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/dwarf-linker/#a463a58e257d5f6fb2c39eb9a2474fc24ac2e06fc138163b7095fa483616a0a47a">DebugLoc</a>(), <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/hexagon/hexagoncopytocombine-cpp/#a1d40004718218dbdf06b496766299101">TII</a>-&gt;get(X86::PAUSE));</Highlight></CodeLine>
